solution.text:
Total Curved Surface Area = \(2\pi rh = _{{j*22}}_ cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow 2rh = \frac{_{{j*22}}_}{\pi} = _{{j*7}}_ cm^2\)
Once you cut the slice, there are three faces without icing: The curved outer surface and the two rectangular inner surfaces. (Remember that the top and bottom surfaces have icing)
Also, length of Base of Slice = Radius of Cylinder and Height of Slice = Height of Cylinder
Therefore, area of the slice that has no icing
= Curved area of slice + 2 \(\times\) Rectangular surface area of slice
\(= \frac{1}{10}\)(Total Curved Surface Area) + 2 \(\times\) (Base \(\times\) Height of slice)
\(= \frac {1}{10}\times _{{j*22}}_ + 2rh\)
\(= \frac {1}{10}\times _{{j*22}}_ + _{{j*7}}_\)
= _{{(Decimal('0.1')*j*22)+(j*7)}}_ \(cm^2\)

content.text: You are given a cylindrical cake with icing on the top and bottom. There is no icing on the curved surface and the curved surface area is \(_{{j*22}}_ cm^2\). You then cut a straight slice from the cake (as shown below) such that the volume of the slice is exactly \(\frac {1}{10}\) of the volume of the cake. What surface area of your slice has no icing?
